info:
To handle the PT network analysis, you need to provide an input file named zonage.geojson with columns 'xxx_density' in item/km² for each category required in the computation of network coverage (eg. population, jobs, health_facilities, etc). 
Catchment radius (in meters) and CAPEX (in €/veh.km) must be filled in the PT links editor, to fit to each route_type. 
The model returns network indicators as tables and GIS layers that can be displayed here.

params.hint: use road network to compute population mesh
params.name: use_road_network

params.hint: factor to compute yearly indicators from daily basis
params.name: coef_day_to_year

params.hint: radius of le clustering zone to identify common sections between PT routes
params.name: clustering_radius

params.hint: max length for a footpath (walk distance between stations)
params.name: max_length

params.hint: as the crow flight walking speed
params.name: speed

params.hint: number of connection between the origin (or destination) and the footpaths
params.name: n_ntlegs
